title: Requires the office of children and family services to collect certain data from any persons admitted into certain facilities
summary: Requires the office of children and family services to collect certain data from any persons admitted into certain facilities.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2445

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. CLARK -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. CORWIN,
         CROUCH -- read once and referred to  the  Committee  on  Children  and
         Families

       AN  ACT  to amend the executive law, in relation to requiring the office
         of children and family services  to  collect  certain  data  from  any
         persons admitted to certain facilities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 501 of the executive law is amended by adding a new
    2  subdivision 17 to read as follows:
    3    17. TO COLLECT OR CAUSE TO BE COLLECTED THE FOLLOWING DATA  CONCERNING
    4  ANY  PERSON ADMITTED TO A FACILITY OPERATED OR LICENSED BY THE OFFICE OF
    5  CHILDREN AND FAMILY SERVICES: (A) SUCH PERSON'S PRIOR  INVOLVEMENT  WITH
    6  THE  CHILD  WELFARE  AND/OR  JUVENILE  JUSTICE SYSTEM, INCLUDING BUT NOT
    7  LIMITED TO: (I) PREVIOUS PLACEMENT IN OUT-OF-HOME CARE, AND THE TYPE  OF
    8  PLACEMENT,  INCLUDING  BUT  NOT  LIMITED  TO  PLACEMENT  IN FOSTER CARE,
    9  KINSHIP FOSTER CARE, SECURE DETENTION FACILITIES,  NON-SECURE  DETENTION
   10  FACILITIES, GROUP HOMES OR OTHER AUTHORIZED AGENCIES OR FACILITIES OPER-
   11  ATED OR LICENSED BY THE OFFICE OF CHILDREN AND FAMILY SERVICES, (II) THE
   12  APPROXIMATE  LENGTH  OF  SUCH  PERIOD OF PLACEMENT, AND (III) THE AGE OF
   13  SUCH PERSON DURING SUCH PERIOD OF PLACEMENT.
   14    (B) STATISTICAL INFORMATION COLLECTED PURSUANT  TO  PARAGRAPH  (A)  OF
   15  THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL BE PUBLISHED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND SHALL BE MADE
   16  AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. SUCH STATISTICAL INFORMATION SHALL BE PUBLISHED
   17  IN SUCH A MANNER AS TO PREVENT THE DISCLOSURE OF PERSONALLY IDENTIFIABLE
   18  INFORMATION.
   19    S  2.  This  act shall take effect on the thirtieth day after it shall
   20  have become a law.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07024-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to requiring the office of children and family services to collect certain data from any persons admitted to certain facilities
